result.execSummary:
The defendant Kyle R Leonard was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/ Intent-LSD (>5grams) [Modifiers: Conspiracy to Commit], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(f)3.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: The Court sentences the Defendant to  8  years Imprisonment, consisting of 3 years Initial Confinement and 5 years Extended Supervision.

superMiscConds.notes:
--to pay costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, to include $250 drug testing fee

**10/13/22: Per Court's order at sentencing and Attorney Huebner's Final Statement of Hours, Defendant to reimburse attorney fees in the amount of $93.50, in addition to attorney fees assessed on original Judgment of Conviction.**
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment per Agent
--to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program per Agent

--no possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription

--take any and all prescription medications only as prescribed by treating physician

--no contact with any know drug offender except for treatment or as deemed appropriate per Agent

 --if permitted to travel out of State, no possession or use of marijuana(THC) in states where it is legal. No legal CBD products or other legal cannabis derivatives without express written permission of agent

--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, or counseling per Agent

--random drug and/or alcohol screening

--to comply with DNA sample provision upon demand

--The Court orders the cash seized be forfeited. 

--If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

records.addlTxt:
[ma] Case called at 4:10 PM 
Defendant Kyle R Leonard in court.  Attorney Karl E Huebner in court for Kyle R Leonard.  Attorney Jeffrey Shock in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Sentencing recommendations/ arguments given by Counsel 
Statement made by Mr. Leonard

The Court rejects Probation. 

The Court sentences the Defendant to  8  years Imprisonment, consisting of 3 years Initial Confinement and 5 years Extended Supervision.  

The Court finds that the Defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp".
The Court finds that the Defendant is NOT eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
The Court gives   0  days credit for time already served.

The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision:
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment per Agent
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, or counseling per Agent
--random drug and/or alcohol screening
--to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program per Agent
--no possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--take any and all prescription medications only as prescribed by treating physician
--no contact with any know drug offender except for treatment or as deemed appropriate per Agent
 --if permitted to travel out of State, no possession or use of marijuana(THC) in states where it is legal. No legal CBD products or other legal cannabis derivatives without express written permission of agent
--to comply with DNA sample provision upon demand
--to pay costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, to include $250 drug testing fee


Felony Firearm and Voting-rights prohibitions/warnings given
Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant

The Court orders the cash seized be forfeited. 
recess: 4:30pm
Sentencing hearing on October 4, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
w/ elements and ccs

[MK] case called at 3:5pm  
Defendant Kyle R Leonard in court with Attorney Karl Huebner. ADA Michael Witt appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
This case is scheduled for Plea & Sentencing today.  Attorney Huebner submits plea-entry documents, however he indicates that Mr. Leonard is not prepared to proceed today. Attorney Huebner provides information regarding Mr. Leonard's family circumstances.
ADA Witt objects to adjournment, noting that on June 28th the Court cancelled the Jury Trial date after Attorney Huebner indicated that Mr. Leonard would proceed to plea and sentencing after being given more time. ADA Witt proposes that the Plea Hearing proceed today, and that Sentencing be scheduled on a later date to allow Mr. Leonard further time to make family-arrangements. 

The Court indicates that it will schedule Sentencing on a later date with the clear understanding that Mr. Leonard will be prepared for forthwith incarceration.  The Court verifies with Mr. Leonard that he understands that the Court's intent is to impose a forthwith sentence.  
 
Constitutional rights reviewed; maximum penalties recited; Elements are recited; plea of " No Contest " is entered on Count #1; factual basis stipulated; the Court accepts the plea, finds the Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Counts #2 through #7. 
recess 4:11pm.

NEXT:  Sentencing Hearing on October 4th at 3:30pm
